Articles.Content:
Hi there i hope you can help me out to find a solution to this.

when i hit the KSP.exe it freeze and shows a white windows, i tried to reinstall and update my drivers video card, also tried to check my directx version its 11

my pc

Intel core i3-2310M CPU@ 2.10GHZ 

RAM 2GB

win7 64 bits 

my video card   Intel(R) HD Graphics 3000(800mb)

ksp version is 1.05; i ran on win7 32bits and it works fine no crashes at all.. but when i try on this pc just crashes 

 

here the output log

here the output log :c thanks very people!

Really your system has only 2GB RAM? KSP Recommended System specifications are 4GB. Given the OS itself reserves a good chunk of RAM for its own use, applications (as KSP.exe) will be able to use only a part (probably 1GB, which is probably not enough to even load KSP).

Also, recommended VRAM (Video Card) is 512MB, your log shows 426MB: probably this latter is the cause of the white screen.

KSP runs definitely better the more RAM and VRAM it has available, but given you are running on a i3 @2.10 GHz the CPU will also be a serious bottleneck (I'd say you aren't going to find the lag with that system enjoyable at all), so rather than considering to improve RAM/VRAM, I'd consider to switch to a more performant PC, also to be able to run newer versions than KSP 1.0.5.

On top of the above, that log has this line: 

The file 'C:/Users/PC/Documents/Kerbal Space Program/KSP_Data/sharedassets0.assets' is corrupted! Remove it and launch unity again!

which would require to reinstall KSP (in theory, you could just copy that file from another install where it certainly works). Please know that file corruption may come both from a bad write to disk, but also because the disk itself has damage in sectors allocated to that file (unless you are sure about your disk health, my advice is to run a disk check so to mark any damaged allocation sector before reinstalling).

hiii i solved the problem there was a problem with" sharedassets0.assets" i just replaced it

 

 

9 hours ago, diomedea said:

Really your system has only 2GB RAM? KSP Recommended System specifications are 4GB. Given the OS itself reserves a good chunk of RAM for its own use, applications (as KSP.exe) will be able to use only a part (probably 1GB, which is probably not enough to even load KSP).

dont worry about it man i were playing ksp on a less performance pc with only 128mb video card or less for me this pc it is better..

 

 

thanks bro 

problem solved

2 hours ago, minerexchanger said:

hiii i solved the problem there was a problem with" sharedassets0.assets" i just replaced it

 

 

dont worry about it man i were playing ksp on a less performance pc with only 128mb video card or less for me this pc it is better..

 

 

thanks bro 

problem solved

Glad you got it solved

To add a little information to your specs.
Unity/KSP loads the game on your RAM. Therefor it can quickly load everything to proces. 
It hardly uses your videocard, except when you're having some visual mods or big textures loaded in the game.

What KSP really pulls is your CPU and RAM.
The reason why the game gets slowly with a many part ship, is because KSP wants to calculate the physics of all the parts.
Mostly the reason why the game crashes is because it's out of RAM. 

Oh and btw, welcome to the forums
